frame.name: Usefulness
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> aids in the successful completion of a <fen>Purpose</fen>. Its <fen>Degree</fen> of utility may also be expressed. Some of the lexical units in this frame (e.g. <ment>great, good</ment>) can only express permanent, generic states of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Entity">A box</fex> is an <t>ideal</t> <fex name="Purpose">storage device</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition: <def-root>The item which is useful for some purpose.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The kind of task which is promoted by the use or presence of the <fen>Entity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The amount that the presence of the <fen>Entity</fen> aids in the completion of the (desirable) <fen>Purpose</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition: <def-root>This Frame Element marks expressions of a <t>Domain</t> or parameter with respect to which the <t>Entity</t> is useful. </def-root>
